Do you remember how (= that) the kids always loved going there?

senses.definition: used to ask about somebody’s health or how well things are going for them
examples: How are you?
How are you feeling now?
(informal) Hey, how are you doing?

senses.definition: used to ask whether something is successful or fun
examples: How was your trip?
How did they play?

senses.definition: used before an adjective or adverb to ask about the amount, degree, etc. of something, or about somebody’s age
examples: How often do you go swimming?
I didn't know how much to bring.
How much are those earrings (= What do they cost)?
How many people were there?
How old is she?

senses.definition: used to express surprise, pleasure, etc.
examples: How kind of you to help!
How he wished he had been there!

senses.definition: in any way in which
examples: I'll dress how I like in my own house!

senses.definition: used when asking for information about somebody/something
examples: I'm not going. How about you?

senses.definition: used to make a suggestion
examples: How about a break?
How about going for a meal?
(especially North American English) How about we go for a meal?

senses.definition: used to show that you think somebody’s behaviour is very bad or are very surprised by it
examples: Ben! How could you? After all they've done for us!
Ugh! How can you eat that stuff?

senses.definition: used to say you do not understand how something can happen and would like an explanation
examples: ‘I think you owe me some money.’ ‘How come?’
If she spent five years in Paris, how come her French is so bad?

senses.definition: used as a formal greeting when you meet somebody for the first time. The usual reply is also How do you do?
used to ask the reason for something
examples: ‘I left work early today.’ ‘How's that (= Why)?’

senses.definition: used when asking somebody’s opinion of something
examples: I'll tuck your sheets in for you. How's that? Comfortable?

senses.definition: used to introduce a statement that contrasts with something that has just been said
examples: He was feeling bad. He went to work, however, and tried to concentrate.

Although politicians have promised to improve road safety, little has been achieved so far.

Government campaigns have had a measure of success, but the fact remains that large numbers of accidents are still caused by careless drivers.

senses.definition: used with an adjective or adverb to mean ‘to whatever degree’
examples: He wanted to take no risks, however small.

senses.definition: in whatever way
examples: However you look at it, it's going to cost a lot.

senses.definition: extremely large in size or amount; great in degree

senses.definition: very successful
examples: I think this band is going to be huge.

senses.definition: of or connected with people rather than animals, machines or gods

a terrible loss of human life

senses.definition: a person who is involved in a subject, issue, etc. and makes it easier for ordinary people to understand and have sympathy with it

senses.definition: kind behaviour, considered to be natural to humans
that considers the needs of ordinary people
examples: This was science with a human face.

senses.definition: a person rather than an animal or a machine

He has a good sense of humour.

senses.definition: the state of your feelings or mind at a particular time
examples: to be in the best of humours

out of humour to be out of humour (= in a bad mood)

senses.definition: one of the four liquids that were thought in the past to be in a person’s body and to influence health and character

senses.definition: a large amount

senses.definition: the years of a particular century

senses.definition: people who do not have enough food to eat

senses.definition: an act of looking for somebody/something that is difficult to find

senses.definition: going after and killing wild animals as a sport or for food

commercial hunting of minke whales
the hunting of deer
traditional country pursuits like hunting, shooting and fishing

examples: How's the job-hunting going?

hurricane-force winds

senses.definition: very quickly or more quickly than usual

senses.definition: not having enough time to do something

hurt (somebody) Stop it. You're hurting me.

it hurts when/if… It hurts when I bend my knee.

it hurts to do something It hurts to breathe.

senses.definition: to feel unhappy or upset

senses.definition: to affect somebody where they will feel it most

senses.definition: to be kind and gentle and unwilling to cause unhappiness
